intro: Lilium longiflorum var. nobile, commonly known as the Christmas lily, is a hybrid variety of the Asiatic lily. It is characterized by its large, white, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late autumn to early winter. The plant is native to the eastern Himalayas and is prized for its elegant appearance and fragrance. It typically grows to a height of 2 to 3 feet and prefers well-drained soil and partial shade. This variety is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and as a cut flower.
